intro: Sorengia longifolia subsp. abscissa, commonly known as the slenderleaf sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes other familiar plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and alternate leaves that are usually lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically greenish-white in color. It prefers moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
